Violent Crime Reduction Plan - Slide Correction

The crime reduction goal of 5% represents the floor not the ceiling. Combined with the collective support of city departments, we believe our stretch goal of 10% is achievable. Crime prevention is everybody’s business. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety

2020 Violent Crime Reduction Plan: Objective Timeline. This plan is a “living” document that provides a comprehensive approach & methodology for reducing crime. DPD will continue to reach out to the community to understand their needs & concerns. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety

Obj 4: Optimize departmental resources which include: Increase diversion of eligible calls for service to the Dallas Online Reporting System(DORS) & expand ratio of civilian to sworn positions: Reclassify existing positions for best use. @ChiefHallDPD
Community engagement: Improve community engagement efforts to identify and meet the goals of the communities we serve. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety
Improve external communication: Uniform data collection and dissemination of information to all agencies. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety
Improve internal communication: Ensure efficient processes exist for the exchange of information both up and down various levels of the organization. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety
Objective Three: Improve coordination and communications within the department and with external partners: @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety

Obj 2: Increase clearance rates & solvability of violent crime: Enhance utilization of record mgmt system: Increase critical incident response. Streamline caseload mgmt: Cases will be assigned using a priority based methodology to improve detective workload. @ChiefHallDPD

Obj 1: Implement a data-driven, comprehensive approach to address people, places, & behaviors impacting violent crime: Create the Intelligence-Led Police Division: Combines Crime Analysis, Fusion Center, Criminal Intelligence Unit, & the Real-Time Crime Center. @ChiefHallDPD
A 5% overall reduction in violent crime would result in 485 fewer victims across the city. The following is a break down by categories: @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety
Reduction efforts will target the offense categories that had the largest increase in 2019. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety •Murders •Aggravated Assaults (non-family violence) •Robberies
"98% of what we do is respond to crime. That's what law enforcement do."@ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety
Violent Crime Initiative –Central Division: Addressed violent crime through partnership with DART and the Dallas housing authority. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety
Project Safe Neighborhood: Partnership with federal, state and local partners focused on reducing gun related violence. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety

Notable decreases in some property crime categories: 13.8%Decrease in residential burglaries 12.8%Decrease in fraud offenses. Property crime is 80% of all crime reported in the city. @ChiefHallDPD #PublicSafety
The #PublicSafety Committee meeting has begun. @ChiefHallDPD will address the committee with the 2020 Violent Crime Reduction Plan.

Reroute or Reschedule Deliveries to Prevent Package Theft. If you are not sure whether or not you will be home for the holidays to receive your package(s) when it arrives. @ChiefHallDPD #DPDSafetyTips

Help us identify a theft suspect.

Use Smart Package Lockers or Convenience Store. To avoid your Amazon package being stolen from your front porch, use an Amazon Locker. Amazon allows you to pick up your delivery in an Amazon Locker at selected locs across the country. @ChiefHallDPD #DPDSafetyTips

Use a temporary P.O. Box. Many delivery services such as UPS or FedEx will not deliver to a traditional P.O. Box address but will deliver to a street address that just happens to be in a Postal Delivery Service Office. @ChiefHallDPD #DPDSafetyTips

Install a package lock-box. If you have deliveries showing up daily, you may want to consider installing a lock-box. These boxes can be bolted to your front porch. Once installed, share your code w/your delivery service and you should be good to go. @ChiefHallDPD #DPDSafetyTips

Ship to the store. Some retailers allow you to ship to a store near you. While this isn’t as convenient, it does provide security and helps avoid long lines at the register. Some stores even offer special parking near the entrance. @DPDChiefHall #DPDAwards

Use a wireless home monitoring system that allows U to see UR porch. You’ll know when packages are being delivered & see visitors, even when U are not at home. Some devices will allow U to set off alarms for snoopers, as well as ask questions to those approaching. @ChiefHallDPD

Insure your holiday packages. Because package thefts increases around the holiday season, it may be wise to place insurance on your packages. This way, if your package is stolen, you can be reimbursed for your loss. @ChiefHallDPD #DPDSafety

Talk to your neighbors. If you have neighbors who are home during the day, consider asking them to collect your packages on the delivery date. More than likely, they’ll be willing to help which can eliminate some holiday stress for you. #DPDSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD
Ship to your local pack and ship store. If you have a UPS, FedEx, or other locally owned packing and shipping store nearby, consider sending your packages there. #DPDSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Signature on delivery. Consider having your packages delivered only when someone is available to sign for them. #DPDSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Ship to an alternate address. Depending on where you work, your company may allow you to ship your packages directly to your place of business. In addition, consider shipping your packages to a friend or relative’s home. #DPDSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Don’t let your packages sit. Monitor when your packages are expected to arrive. Leaving your packages on your porch or in your mailbox overnight or for a couple of days is an open invitation to thieves. #DPDSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Online shopping has made life easy for all of us, including package thieves, better known as porch pirates. As everyone is getting ready for the holiday season & doing their shopping, @DallasPD would like will be sharing safety tips for package delivery this week. @ChiefHallDPD
Don’t forget your umbrella and remember, roads will be slick this morning. Please allow yourself extra travel time for you commute. #BeWeatherAware #SafetyFirst @ChiefHallDPD
Be sure to plan ahead tomorrow morning and allow yourself extra driving time for travel. #BeWeatherAware #Traffic #SafetyFirst

The @NWSFortWorth calls for a strong cold front 2day & 2night bringing light rain/snow mix through 2 am. Plz allow yourself extra driving time in preparation for the inclement weather. The 3 key elements to safe winter driving are: Stay alert; Slow down; and. Stay in control.

@DallasPD recommends for future safety that scooter companies equip scooters w/front & back lights & reflectors for increased visibility. Also to restrict use in specific zones w/high pedestrian traffic and regulate top speed.
@bswhealth_DFW reports there have been 321 ER visits related to scooter injuries, 47 hospitals admissions, 13 severely injured, and 1 death.
In addition to safety concerns, it is also a drain on @DallasPD resources. @ChiefHallDPD
There were two take-over events in which 45 citations were issued, 5 arrests were made, and 2 dirt bikes were impounded. @ChiefHallDPD
Officers will ensure public safety of pedestrians and motorists by engaging individuals that are not following laws related to motorized scooters or operating in an unsafe manner. @ChiefHallDPD
Since January 1, 2019, there have been approximately 66 citations issues to individuals operating scooters for violations. @ChiefHallDPD
Texas Transportation Code Chapter 551

If enforcement is necessary, scooter operators can be cited for enforcement action: Dallas City Code sec. 43-169. Dockless vehicle parking, deployment & operation and Texas Transportation Code Chapter 551.
In most cases, officers will give warnings and educate the individuals before issuing citations. @ChiefHallDPD
@DallasPD understands that individuals utilizing a rental scooters are from out of town & unaware of #Texas traffic laws & #Dallas city ordinances. @ChiefHallDPD
Areas of high safety concern are: the Central Business District, Deep Ellum, Bishop Arts, Katy Trail, & Uptown. @ChiefHallDPD
The primary concern of @DallasPD regarding electric scooters is the safety of pedestrians, preventing motor vehicle accidents, & the safety of the operators. @ChiefHallDPD
Chief Castro briefs the Public Safety Committee on dockless vehicle enforcement. @ChiefHallDPD
RIGHT Care is an integrated field response team and dispatch clinician based program. RIGHT: Rapid Integrated Group Healthcare Team Care @ChiefHallDPD

The RIGHT Care Program includes specially trained and equipped police officers, paramedics, and mental health professionals who will respond as a team to safely and effectively manage patients experiencing behavioral emergencies.@ChiefHallDPD
The collaboration of the RIGHT Care program consists of @CityOfDallas @DallasPD @dfrincidents @Parkland and @NTBHA6 working together. @ChiefHallDPD
RIGHT Care launched in January 2018 and is supported by the Caruth Foundation. @ChiefHallDPD

Give someone close to you a copy of your trip itinerary and photocopies of important documents before you leave. This will give law enforcement the ability to retrace your route in cases where you did not reach your destination. #DPDTravelSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Wash your hands frequently with soap or antibacterial hand sanitizer. This is especially important if you are traveling via public conveyance. Everything you touch has been touched by someone else, including armrests and door handles. #DPDTravelSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Stay hydrated. While you may not think of dehydration as a holiday travel safety hazard, not having enough water during a long drive could cause fatigue or decreased alertness. Keep a few bottles of water handy. #DPDTravelSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Make frequent rest stops. Driving in the winter can tire you out much more than in the summer. Even just stopping for a few minutes every few hours can do wonders for your energy level. #DPDTravelSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD
Reminder: Do not buy more than you can carry. Plan ahead by taking a friend with you or asking a store employee to help you carry your packages to the car. #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Plan your drive ahead of time and know alternate routes. Also, if you want to avoid traffic, plan to leave at a specific time when you might be able to drive through that area before or after peak traffic times. #DPDTravelSafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Do not leave packages visible in your car. Lock them in the trunk, or if possible, take them directly home. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD
Tell a security guard or store employee if you see an unattended bag or package. The same applies if you are using mass transit. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

To avoid purchasing counterfeit products, carefully examine the products you want to buy for signs of missing info, broken or missing safety seals, different or incomplete packaging, & subtle or obvious changes to a logo. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD
Have your keys in hand when approaching your vehicle. Check the back seat and around the car before getting in. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD
Shop with companies you know and trust. Check for background information if you plan to buy from a new or unfamiliar company. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD
Deter pickpockets. Carry your purse close to your body or your wallet inside a coat or front trouser pocket. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Use secure websites for purchases. Look for the icon of a locked padlock at the bottom of the screen or “https” in the URL address. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Wait until asked by a cashier before taking out your credit card or checkbook. An enterprising thief would love to shoulder surf to get your account information. #CyberMonday #BlackFriday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Dallas Police responded to a shooting call at 12100 Abrams Road. Upon arrival, officers found the victim, James Burks, deceased from multiple gunshot wounds. Anyone with information regarding this incident contact Det. Anderson at (214) 671-3616.
Beware of “bargains” from companies with whom you are unfamiliar — if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is! #BlackFriday #CyberMonday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Save all receipts. Print and save all confirmations from your online purchases. Start a file folder to keep all receipts together and to help you verify credit card or bank statements as they come in. #BlackFriday #CyberMonday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Dallas police responded to 8124 Forest Ln regarding a shooting. The victim Erick Blakely a B/M/43 was shot and taken to an area hospital where he died from his injuries. Anyone w/ information please contact Detective Jacob White at 214-283-4825

Keep your personal info private & your password secure. Do not respond to requests to “verify” your password or credit card info unless you initiated the contact. Legitimate businesses will not contact you in this manner. #BlackFriday #CyberMonday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

Don’t flash the cash. Consider alternate options to pay for your merchandise, such as onetime or multi-use disposable credit cards or money orders, including at online stores. #BlackFriday #CyberMonday #SafetyTips @ChiefHallDPD

@DallasPD is very excited to announce that through the hard work of @SaferDallas, @MotoSolutions, and our own DPD team, the #Starlight Program has moved from concept to reality. @ChiefHallDPD
@ChiefHallDPD answers various questions from media about the #Starlight program.
“This is an example of 21st Century policing using technology to provide virtual policing. “ @ChiefHallDPD
The #Starlight program will launch at four different locations in #Dallas including #District4. @ChiefHallDPD
Representatives from @MotoSolutions talk about working to help make the #Starlight program a success. @ChiefHallDPD
@DallasPD is committed to providing the safest, most efficient service possible for both our community and our officers and #Starlight will help us do just that. @ChiefHallDPD

Lt. Lewis oversaw the implementation of the #Starlight program. When a call comes out from a Starlight location, patrol units are notified, and real-time information can be passed to responding officers. @ChiefHallDPD
The #Starlight Program places high-resolution cameras at convenience stores and gas stations with a history of high-call volume. We now have virtual visual patrol @ChiefHallDPD
#Starlight: Real-time intelligence. The ability to see what is happening at a crime scene before the first officer arrives. @ChiefHallDPD @SaferDallas
#Starlight presser about to begin with @ChiefHallDPD. @SaferDallas
@ChiefHallDPD talks to community members before the #Starlight press conference. @SaferDallas

Have a safe and Happy #Halloween! #HalloweenSafety @ChiefHallDPD
Be careful when you cross a street. Make sure to look in both directions. Cross only when safe. #HalloweenSafety #Halloween @ChiefHallDPD

Make sure children know your cellphone number, their home telephone number, and address in case you are separated. Consider giving them a cellphone so they can reach you easily. Teach children how to call 911 in an emergency. #Halloween #HalloweenSafety @ChiefHallDPD

Teach children to say “NO!” in a loud voice if someone tries to get them to go somewhere, accept anything other than a treat, or leave with them. Tell them to try everything they can to escape, including yelling, hitting, and kicking. #Halloween #HalloweenSafety @ChiefHallDPD
Be sure children do not approach any vehicle, occupied or not, unless you are with them. #HalloweenSafety #Halloween @ChiefHallDPD
Examine all treats for choking hazards and tampering before eating them. Limit the amount of treats you eat. #HalloweenSafety #Halloween @ChiefHallDPD
Hold a flashlight while trick-or-treating to help you see and others see you. WALK and don't run from house to house. #Halloween #HalloweenSafety @ChiefHallDPD
Plan a trick-or-treating route in familiar neighborhoods with well-lit streets. #HalloweenSafety #Halloween @ChiefHallDPD

Today, @ChiefHallDPD, DPD Lieutenant James Lewis and @SaferDallas Chairperson Gary Griffith, announced the relaunch of iWatchDallas App. Steve Elliott of Zeteky Inc. presented a brief demonstration of the new and improved app.
With your help, we can all strive to make Dallas a safer place to live and play. @ChiefHallDPD #iWatchDallas

We are committed to serving the citizens of Dallas through a cooperative working relationship between the police and the people they serve. The success of solving crime lies in the actions of the citizens who know of, or see these criminal acts. @ChiefHallDPD #iWatchDallas
The iWatchDallas also features the ability to chat anonymously in real-time and send media. @ChiefHallDPD #iWatchDallas
Download the iWatchDallas app and follow the steps to submit a tip. @ChiefHallDPD #iWatchDallas
The iWatchDallas app was made possible through a partnership with Safer Dallas Better Dallas whose mission it is to make our city a safer place to live. @ChiefHallDPD #iWatchDallas
Lt. Lewis says this is a better way to connect to our citizens to directly receive tips and help prevent crime. @ChiefHallDPD #iWatchDallas

iWatch Dallas allows our citizens to harness the communication capabilities of the internet/social networking sites to report crime tips and leads. The app is a new and innovative tool to increase our community wide effort to reduce crime. @ChiefHallDPD #iWatchDallas

@ChiefHallDPD announcing the re-launch of the new and improved iWatchDallas app. It’s a tip program that puts the ability to report suspicious or criminal activity from your phone, tablet or computer. For immediate assistance, dial 911. #Anonymous #Anywhere #Anytime #iWatchDallas

We received numerous tips that led us to execute a search warrant for Mr. Brown’s apartment. We confiscated 12 lbs. of marijuana, 149 grams of THC cartridges and $4,157 in cash. @ChiefHallDPD
Jacquerious is driven to the hospital and where he is now in police custody. Warrants will be executed for him and the other two suspects for Capital murder. @ChiefHallDPD
Thaddeous took Mr. Brown’s backpack and gun used to shoot Jacquerious and they speed off. Michael Mitchell is the driver. @ChiefHallDPD
Jacquerious exits his vehicle and Mr. Brown shoots him in the chest. He falls into vehicle and hears two gunshots. He says Thaddeous shot Mr. Brown twice in the lower body. @ChiefHallDPD

All suspects have travelled from Alexandria, LA to purchase drugs from Joshua Brown. According to Jacquerious, Green contacted Mr. Brown to purchase drugs. A physical altercation ensues as Green talks with Brown. @ChiefHallDPD

KPMG Staffing commends DPD’s leadership and commitment for a more sustainable way to staff and schedule. KPMG third option or suggestion is to use a combination of overtime hours and full time employees to meet workload volume while minimizing costs.

KPMG Staffing lays out 3 scenarios for better decision making as it pertains to DPD’s staffing and scheduling. Personnel suggests realigning current staff to best meet projected demand or hire and redistribute full time employees to meet workload volume 100% of the time.

.@ChiefHallDPD first day back after being on FMLA. She talks with Assistant Police Chief Pughes @CityOfDallas Council meeting. They will discuss the staffing study and annual budget and provide an update on summer crime initiatives and meet and confer.

Today, Chief Hall returns to duty after being on family medical leave. She truly appreciates the many kind words and prayers from the City of Dallas and community. Hall is excited about resuming her normal activity and cannot thank DPD enough for their excellent work.

Because this is an active crime scene, vehicles parked inside the inner perimeters will have to remain for the next few hours until the scene has been processed. Owners can call the Command Post at 214.470.4954 for updates or follow us on social media.

The crime scene has been reduced to the following street closers: No thru traffic on north and southbound Griffin from Commerce to Wood St. No thru traffic on Jackson St. from Lamar and Field. Commerce and Lamar are now open in both directions.

Although the susp vehicle has been rendered safe, this is still an active scene in the downtown area. Please avoid traveling on Lamar St between Young and Main St. Also, Field and Akard between Young and Elm St. We will update you shortly with changes.

Standing next to the displayed of an airborne car illustrating the moments before the crash killed Kailee are her parents David and Wendy Mills. Nearby video Kiosks tell the story of this tragic event. @kmillscharity #ClickItOrTicket

16-yr-old Kailee Mills of Spring, Tx, lost her life on October 2017. She was a few blocks from home when she Only for second removed her seatbelt to take a selfie with her friend. In that split second a life was lost. Buckle up. Every passenger, every ride. #ClickItOrTicket
Studies Show that wearing your seat belt during a vehicle crash increases your odds of survival by up to 45%. Don’t be just another statistic #ClickItOrTicket

Enforcement of Click It Or Ticket runs from May 20th – June 4th. When first introduced in 2002 only 76% of Texans used seatbelts Today nearly 92% use their seat belts. Along with @TxDPS & @Dallas_Sheriff we will be out enforcing #ClickItOrTicket Day and night.

Theodore Roosevelt Ceremony Honored Officer Crystal Almeida Today
Toby Roosevelt concludes the #TRAPoliceAward ceremony. Thank you Officer Almeida for your bravery, dedication and commitment to duty. It is an honor to have you serve the citizens of Dallas.
Officer Almeida’s determination and commitment to duty allowed her to return to work 3 months after being shot twice in the face. #TRAPoliceAward @TRooseveltAssoc
Presentation of the 2019 TRA Award by Stuart Bumpas #TRAPoliceAward

Officer Almeida continues to be a vital member of the Dallas Police Department despite losing her sight in one of her eyes. She endures daily painful hours of physical therapy daily but continues to display the same high spirits she had prior to being shot. #TRAPoliceAward

This year, Officer Crystal Almeida Perez will receive the @TRooseveltAssoc Police Award. She was seriously injured while responding to a call on April 25, 2018. Her partner, Officer Rogelio Santander Jr. was also shot and killed in that same incident. #TRAPoliceAward

The @TRooseveltAssoc recognizes a DPD officer who has overcome a life threatening injury, illness, and who demonstrates exceptional courage, determination, and perseverance while overcoming adversity and ultimately returning to serve with the department.

The Public Safety Committee eating has concluded.
Overview of current vs. proposed
Continuation of recommendations:

The following DPD recommendations for the Citizens Police Review Board coincide with the philosophy of 21st Century Policing and were developed as a result of research, meetings, surveys, and feedback from stakeholders.
Stakeholder Input from survey participation & other feedback from Town Hall Meetings.
Citizens Police Review Board (CPRB): The Coalition felt the CPRB was an ineffective tool for fulfilling goals: Building trust, Strengthening accountability & Improving police/community relations.
Collectively, the community groups formed as the Community Police Oversight Board Coalition & identified 3 areas of community concern related to the Dallas Police Department.
In October 2017, @DallasPD began meeting with community groups with concerns surrounding police conduct.
By facilitating integrity-driven policing that is focused on building trust, strengthening relationships, & community collaboration, Dallas will be a safer place to live, work, & play.
@DallasPD is continuing to innovate through community focused engagement by implementing best practices consistent with 21st Century Policing.
@ChiefHallDPD briefs the Public Safety Committee on the Citizens Police Review Board. (CPRB)

Press Conference with Asst. Chief Stokes regarding new Vice Unit. https://www.facebook.com/DallasPD/videos/1080159182144790/
The Public Safety Committee Meeting has concluded.
Detectives will be provided with a robust training regimen with a victim-centric approach.
There will also be a Licensing Squad that will focus on financial investigations (money laundering) & license applications for billiards halls and sexually-oriented businesses.
Two squads of enforcement detectives will be on rotating shifts. They will focus street-level prostitution, human trafficking, and gambling locations. #HumanTrafficking
The new Vice Unit will have a “service first” approach that is a victim-centric philosophy.
The new vice unit will consist of 21 members and will begin November 28, 2018.
Asst. Chief Stokes will be briefing the media regarding the new Vice Unit.
Crimes against persons is down 5.9% versus last year. Property Crime is down 1.4% versus last year.
The Public Safety Meeting is about to begin. Chief Pughes will be briefing the Public Safety Committee on the @DallasPD update. @ChiefHallDPD will be sitting in for Asst. City Mgr Jon Fortune.

The Medal of Valor is awarded to Officer Crystal Almeida. She who was seriously injured on Tuesday, April 24, 2018 in the line of duty while attempting to arrest a suspect. Officer Almeida, who has served with the Dallas Police Department for 3 years, is now with the Gang Unit.

THE 1st AWARDS CATEGORY IS THE MEDAL OF VALOR. This medal is awarded when an ofcr has performed at imminent risk of serious bodily injury, w/the recipient having demonstrated exceptional bravery by performing a voluntary course of action in an extremely dangerous situation.

The Police Cross is awarded to OFFICER ROGELIO SANTANDER, JR. Accepting the award is his partner, Officer Crystal Almeida. Our second Police Cross goes to: SENIOR CORPORAL EARL “JAMIE” GIVENS III . His mother Delores will accept the award. #FriendsofDPD

We will also pay tribute to the fallen officers we lost this past year. The police cross is awarded to an officer who performed under honorable circumstances & paid the ultimate sacrifice. 2nightwe will honor & pay tribute to those who made the ultimate sacrifice. #FriendsofDPD

#DPDinReview This year, DPD transitioned to the NIBRS crime reporting system making us the largest agency in the nation certified to submit NIBRS data. Using the NIBRS data, DPD can identify patterns & trends & have a more comprehensive overview of crime stats within the city.

#DPDinReview This year, DPD & OfferUp unveiled the city’s first Exchange Zone. This Community MeetUp Spot is designed to create a safer space for buyers & sellers from online & mobile marketplaces to complete their transactions in a well-lit, monitored environment. #SouthCentral

@DPDAnderson “Community engagement and youth outreach programs are essential to building and maintaining strong relationships between the police and citizens of our community.” @dallasschools @AspenInstitute
Top teams will win an opportunity to present at the Aspen Institute’s annual Aspen Ideas Festival in Aspen, Colorado. @dallasschools @AspenInstitute

The Aspen Challenge will provide students with tools and support them along an eight-week journey of solution design that culminates in a daylong showcase. They will reconvene March 27, 2018 for the competition, where they will present their innovative solutions.

The inaugural Aspen Challenge, launched in 2013 in collaboration with Los Angeles Unified School District. Since its inception, the Challenge has expanded to include partnerships with school districts in Denver, Washington D.C., Chicago, Philadelphia, and most recently, Dallas.
The Aspen Challenge is a program of the Aspen Institute which provides inspiration, tools, and a platform for young people to design solutions to some of today’s most critical issues.

Right Care is an actual acronym that means “Rapid Intergrated Group Health Care”

The program will consist of three RIGHT Care team members, a specially-trained police officer, paramedic and behavioral health specialist from Parkland that will be dispatched to respond to behavioral-health related calls.
The first phase of this program will launch Jan. 29 in South Central Dallas, thanks to a generous grant from The W. W. Caruth, Jr., Foundation at Communities Foundation of Texas (Caruth).

The first-of-its-kind program in Texas is an innovative partnership involving specially-trained and equipped paramedics, police officers & mental health professionals who will respond as a single coordinated team to effectively manage patients experiencing behavioral emergencies.
@DPDStokes explaining the police component of the Right Care Program.
The Right Care Program will provide a comprehensive emergency response to calls involving behavioral health emergencies. @DPDStokes @AShawDPD

The Dallas Police Department, The Meadows Mental Health Policy Institute (MMHPI), Dallas Fire- Rescue Department and Parkland Health & Hospital System announce the launch of the Rapid Integrated Group Healthcare Team (RIGHT Care) pilot program.

The press conference has concluded.
Celebrate the holidays safely and responsibly. And remember Do Not Fire Guns Into The Air.
If you call 911 to report a gun fire or fireworks, try to give as much information as possible to the call taker. Location, any suspect info
If you ever see someone fire a gun into the air, call the police.
Don't fire guns in the air. Bullets travel at a high rate of speed coming back down. #WhatGoesUpMustComeDown
People involved in celebrating the holidays by shooting their guns do not realize the danger posed by their actions.
If a stray bullet from your gun should kill someone, you will be arrested and charged with Criminally Negligence or Manslaughter.
If you are arrested for shooting a gun into the air, you will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.
Shooting a gun into the air is a Class A misdemeanor. You will spend up to one year in jail if caught.
A bullet fired into the air can climb up to two miles. When it falls back to earth, it can reach a speed of 300 to 700 feet per second.
But, the problem still persists.
Law enforcement, in partnership with the community, local businesses and the media, has made an impact on reducing indiscriminate gunfire
DallasPD is asking once more for the community to celebrate responsibly.
This conference is to bring public awareness to the citizens of Dallas that firing a gun into the air can have consequences.

The staff recommendation is to conduct a review of best practices, procedures, and technology changes to improve the Safelight Program.
Beginning in June, the enforcement penalty for a red light camera violation will be a vehicle registration hold.
This is a safety program and the 9-year safety report indicates a 63% average reduction in red light running crashes.
The red-light photo enforcement system allows police officers to focus on call answering and investigative duties.
Also, we want to increase public awareness to modify driving behavior.
The purpose of the Safelight Program is to improve public safety by increasing enforcement of red light laws

Response times can be improved w/the addition of police resources available to respond to calls.
Critical incident calls require more man power, which in turn ties up more officers to handle each call.
Slowing down instead of rushing into critical incident scenarios promotes greater officer & citizen safety.
Officers are not rushing into critical incident calls (mental health) -waiting on cover & utilizing training to handle such calls.
Officers are spending more time on calls to provide a better customer service experience.
While response times are important, quality of service typically leaves a lasting, positive impression.
There is no national standard for response times, each agency is unique based on geography, demographics, & strategic goals of the dept.
Response time facts include: DPD's Response time goals were established in 2007. Providing ETA is a challenge due to the consequences
Officer travel time constraints: traffic/road conditions/time of day, weather, ofcr flagged down, ofcr diverted to higher priority call.
Dispatcher constraints: Officer(s) availability, #of ofcrs needed based on type f call(mental health calls, major incidents)
911 Operator Constraints: time spent gathering info, caller unintelligible, loc unknown, type of call-priority 1 calls are 2 part.
Calls are prioritized based on information provided at the time of the call.
The process of a 911 call for service is a concerted effort by the 911 operator, police dispatcher, & responding patrol officer.
@DPDPage briefs Public Safety on the Communications Operations Center on the handling of calls for service
@DPDChief stated CP 2.0 helps keeps the department prepared. Officers can be deployed at any time as the need arises for homelands security
Officers in CP 2.0 receives refresher training at the academy on body cameras, RMS, MDC, deescalation, & use of force.
Chief Cadena said it is a difference in policing. The complexity of the job includes more technology and demands for more training.
to continue DPD's effort to connect to the community., reduce 911 call response times, and reduce crime.
Going forward, the need to incorporate CP 2.0 officers into patrol duties will remain in order
CP 2.0 officers responded to 5,128 calls for police service & made 95 felony arrests through March 18, 2016.
CP 2.0 officers are scheduled to work 4p-12a. These hours they are working are typically the highest for 911 calls and violent crimes.
Proactive enforcement activities are focused on high crime areas.
CP 2.0 assists & improves response times in all 7 Patrol Bureau divisions.
Patrol Bureau receives additional officers & sergeants from non-patrol bureaus within the department for call answering
C.P 2.0 is DPD's effort to keep all officers connected to the community through basic policing in the Patrol Bureau
Chief Cadena briefs Public Safety on Community Policing 2.0. (CP 2.0)
@DPDChief informed CM Kingston that the additional CP 2.0 officers in patrol will be increase the state of readiness for homeland security

@DPDChief "We're not going to violate civil rights, we are going to do what we need to do to reduce crime & make sure our officers go home."
@DPDChief "We are going to respect our citizen's rights while we work to reduce crime."
@DPDChief "We know it is sometimes a thankless job but it is a good time to show support for our officers."
CP 2.0 increased about 12 additional officers at each patrol station on evening shifts.
Response times has reduced significantly due to additional officers working CP 2.0.
@DPDChief "These are our neighborhoods, this is our city, and we are determined to protect our citizens."
@DPDChief "I live in the City of Dallas. I was born & raised here. I'm a 3rd generation Dallasite"
Officers & Command Staff will also do #footpatrols in high #crime areas & our entertainment districts to increase police prescence.

This is a sense of urgency & it's going to take great sacrifices from our officers.
@DPDChief we will lay it on the line for the next several months & as long as it takes to reduce crime to protect our citizens.
@DPDChief asks that all citizens join me in praying for their safety as they take on this challenge each day to save lives.

@DallasPD Chief David O. Brown Announces Deployment of New Task Forces
This strategy requires officers to adjust their normal schedules, assignments, and to significantly increase their work volume.
Foot patrols ~ Officer deployments to proactively walk in geographic high crime areas throughout the city to increase police presence
Community Policing 2.0:Ofcr frm non-patrol bureau positions w/in the dept 2 the field to assist w/call answering & crime fighting
Property Crime Task Force ~ Officer deployments to geographic high volume home burglary and car burglary areas
Narcotic Drug Warrant Teams ~ Closing down drug houses and arresting drug dealers
Domestic Violence Warrant Teams ~ Arresting domestic violence offenders expeditiously
Strategically we will focus on the following: Violent Crime Task Force ~ Officer deployments to geographic high volume violent crime areas
Therefore, in response, we are bringing to bear the full force of the police department, in our efforts to save lives.
The protection of the whole community is our primary duty and responsibility, and we take this very seriously.
This is unacceptable to the men and women of the Dallas Police Department.

This is not a focus on those who are homeless, but a focus on aggressive panhandlers.
If they must be taken to the hospital for medical issues, the officers transport them to Parkland for treatment and issue a citation.
Aggressive panhandling subjects are arrested and taken to jail.
Upon identifying aggressive violations, uniforms take custody and utilize the paddy wagon for transport.
We also utilize officers in plain clothes to identify aggressive violations.
Officers on-view the aggressive panhandling behavior, then take the subjects into custody and call the paddy wagon.
As is standing at or in front of a business demanding money as patrons enter and exit, and then shouting obscenities when money is not given
Additionally, blocking or impeding sidewalks in an effort to coerce money from fellow pedestrians is seen as aggressive.
While the term can be subjective, we recognize the acts of walking into the streets to approach vehicles and demand money as aggressive.
This is not a zero-tolerance operation, but rather an effort to impact aggressive and unsafe behavior associated with panhandling.
We address the West End restaurants and patios along with the businesses along the core of Main, Elm, and Commerce streets.
Locations include all of our 7-11 and CVS stores in the downtown area, the curves for SB I-45 to WB I-30 and into the “canyon” area of I-30.
